channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Measles spreads in Texas. And, how U.S. funding cuts could benefit China
item.description: A measles outbreak in West Texas has sparked concern as cases have more than doubled since last week. And, China seeks to support pro-democracy groups in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
A measles outbreak in West Texas has sparked concern as cases have more than doubled since last week. And, China seeks to support pro-democracy groups in the U.S.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: FDA staff handling drug safety for pets and livestock lost jobs in Trump firings
item.description: The fired staffers were tasked with making sure medications given to animals work well and are safe.
item.content:encoded:
The fired staffers were tasked with making sure medications given to animals work well and are safe.

(Image credit: JOSEPH PREZIOSO/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Lori Chavez-DeRemer, Trump's Labor Department pick, to face questions from senators
item.description: The confirmation hearing for the former Oregon representative nominated to lead the Labor Department is to start Wednesday. The secretary of labor holds the 11th Cabinet position in the presidential line of succession.
item.content:encoded:
The confirmation hearing for the former Oregon representative nominated to lead the Labor Department is to start Wednesday. The secretary of labor holds the 11th Cabinet position in the presidential line of succession.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Is Trump preparing to cancel America's ride back to the moon?
item.description: President Trump launched the Artemis program to return U.S. astronauts to the moon for the first time since Apollo. Now, the plan could be a casualty of the cost-cutting drive overseen by Elon Musk.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump launched the Artemis program to return U.S. astronauts to the moon for the first time since Apollo. Now, the plan could be a casualty of the cost-cutting drive overseen by Elon Musk.

(Image credit: Joel Kowsky)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: She worked for years to get a federal job. Within a month, she was fired
item.description: Rose is one of thousands of federal workers who have been terminated by the Trump administration. At 26, she's left wondering what to do now.
item.content:encoded:
Rose is one of thousands of federal workers who have been terminated by the Trump administration. At 26, she's left wondering what to do now.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy says it is time to find his successor
item.description: Louis DeJoy said he plans to step down after a nearly five-year tenure marked by the coronavirus pandemic, surges in mail-in election ballots and efforts to stem losses through cost and service cuts.
item.content:encoded:
Louis DeJoy said he plans to step down after a nearly five-year tenure marked by the coronavirus pandemic, surges in mail-in election ballots and efforts to stem losses through cost and service cuts.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: More than 150 false killer whales stranded on a beach in Australia's Tasmania state
item.description: The reasons for the beachings are unclear. Reasons could include disorientation caused by loud noises, illness, old age, injury, fleeing predators and severe weather.
item.content:encoded:
The reasons for the beachings are unclear. Reasons could include disorientation caused by loud noises, illness, old age, injury, fleeing predators and severe weather.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Dominican officials cram thousands of inmates facing no charges into overcrowded prisons
item.description: Despite promises to improve the system, problems within prisons keep mounting. Critics say the Dominican Republic continues to push for pretrial detentions in cases where no charges have been filed.
item.content:encoded:
Despite promises to improve the system, problems within prisons keep mounting. Critics say the Dominican Republic continues to push for pretrial detentions in cases where no charges have been filed.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Nearly 300 deportees from U.S. held in Panama hotel
item.description: The migrants hailed from 10 mostly Asian countries the U.S. has difficulty deporting migrants to directly. Panama is being used as a stopover.
item.content:encoded:
The migrants hailed from 10 mostly Asian countries the U.S. has difficulty deporting migrants to directly. Panama is being used as a stopover.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says Elon Musk's $10 million settlement over Twitter suit was 'a big discount'
item.description: It's the second tech company to agree to a payout after the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol prompted Trump to be kicked off numerous social media platforms.
item.content:encoded:
It's the second tech company to agree to a payout after the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol prompted Trump to be kicked off numerous social media platforms.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn
